dirtypng.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /*H********************************************************************************/
2 /*!
3  \File dirtypng.h
4 
5  \Description
6  Routines to decode a PNG into a raw image and palette. These routines
7  were written from scratch based on the published specifications. The
8  functions and style were heavily based on the dirtygif.c and dirtyjpeg.c
9  files coded by James Brookes.
10 
11  Supported features
12  Bit Depth of 1, 2, 4, and 8
13  Colour Type 0, 2, 4, 6 (grayscale, truecolor, grayscale with alpha, truecolor with alpha)
14  Noncompressed blocks, statically compressed blocks, dynamically compressed blocks
15  Zlib compression levels 0, 1, 2 and 9 (none through maximum)
16  Interlace method Adam7
17  Filter types 0-4 (none, sub, up, average, paeth)
18 
19  Unsupported features
20  Bit Depth of 16 support
21  Colour Type 3 (Indexed Color support)
22  PLTE chunk support
23  Ancillary chunk support
24 
25  \Notes
26  References:
27  [1] http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/
28  [2] http://www.gzip.org/zlib/rfc1950.pdf
29  [3] http://www.gzip.org/zlib/rfc1951.pdf
30  [4] http://www.zlib.net/feldspar.html
31  [5] http://www.schaik.com/pngsuite/#basic
32 
33  \Copyright
34  Copyright (c) 2007 Electronic Arts Inc.
35 
36  \Version 02/05/2007 (christianadam) First Version
37 */
38 /********************************************************************************H*/
39 
40 #ifndef _dirtypng_h
41 #define _dirtypng_h
42

88 //! structure to represent a parsed png
89 typedef struct DirtyPngHdrT
90 {
91  // image info
92  const uint8_t *pImageData; //!< pointer to start of png bits
93  const uint8_t *pImageEnd; //!< pointer to end of png bits
94  uint32_t uWidth; //!< image width
95  uint32_t uHeight; //!< image height
96 
97  // misc info
98  int8_t iBitDepth; //!< bit depth of the image
99  int8_t iColourType; //!< colour type of the image
100  int8_t iCompression; //!< compression method of the image
101  int8_t iFilter; //!< filter method of the image
102  int8_t iInterlace; //!< interlace method of the image
103 } DirtyPngHdrT;
